intro: Baeria aristata f. varia, commonly known as the variegated baeria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features striking variegated foliage with shades of green, white, and yellow, making it a visually appealing ornamental species. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Due to its unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value.
